description.narrative: Output 4.4 : A range of gender-sensitive, multi-sector adolescent-led initiatives are available to empower and meaningfully engage adolescents to be change agents in their communities., which contributes to Access To Justice, Adolescent Empowerment, Harmful Practices (Fgm/C And Child Marriage), Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Improved and equitable preventive and responsive services addressing violence, abuse and exploitation of children

sector.narrative: Services to prevent or respond to violence, exploitation and abuse

title.narrative: Yemen United Nations Development Assistance Framework
Description of UNICEF programming approach framework at the country level with Common Country Assessments (CCAs) providing the equivalence of pre project appraisals

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 4.4 : A range of gender-sensitive, multi-sector adolescent-led initiatives are available to empower and meaningfully engageadolescents to be change agents in their communities.

description.narrative: A total of 5,689 adolescents (4,240 girls; 1,449 boys) in schools and in youth clubs were empowered with 12 life skills and used their new skills to engage with their peers on child/adolescent issues, including protection risks in the context of COVID-19. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:17/01/2021

title.narrative: A range of gender-sensitive, multi-sector adolescent-led initiatives are available to empower and meaningfully engage adolescents to be change agents in their communities.(64685)
% of adolescents engaged in the life skills programme subsequently engaged in initiatives which engage them to be change-agents in their communities(57791)
